alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 15 at 11:06PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Multiple rounds of torrential showers are anticipated Sunday through Sunday night. There is increasing confidence that locally considerable impacts are possible for areas with repeating activity. Highest threat areas are those that have been recently affected by heavy rain as well as highly sloped, fast-responding small streams in the mountains. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EDT SUNDAY THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash floods caused by multiple rounds of torrential downpours. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following areas, Androscoggin, Central Interior Cumberland, Central Somerset, Coastal Cumberland, Coastal Waldo, Coastal York, Interior Cumberland Highlands, Interior Waldo, Interior York, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Northern Franklin, Northern Oxford, Sagadahoc, Southern Franklin, Southern Oxford and Southern Somerset. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Belknap, Cheshire, Coastal Rockingham, Eastern Hillsborough, Interior Rockingham, Merrimack, Northern Carroll, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Carroll, Southern Coos, Southern Grafton, Strafford, Sullivan and Western And Central Hillsborough. * WHEN...From 6 AM EDT Sunday through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding can involve major disruptions to travel, damages to property, and displacement of people. The risk is high for campers near fast responding streams which could become dangerous rivers with flood waters spreading well away from the banks. Inundation of roads are likely with additional washouts and some long term closures possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Multiple rounds of torrential rainfall are expected. Saturated soils from recent rainfall will support rapid runoff and lead to flash flooding. Considerable impacts are possible where storms repeat.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. If you are in a flood prone area, prepare for rapid onset flooding, with minimum time to react. Never camp on low ground next to streams since a flash flood can catch you while you`re asleep.
